events.message: The customer reported a car accident involving their vehicle on the highway. Immediate claim filing was initiated to start processing.
The claim was reviewed and categorised under Auto Accident due to keywords like car and collision present in the report.
An insurance agent was assigned to the case to assist the customer with claim processing and next steps following the vehicle accident.
The insurance company sent an acknowledgment to the customer confirming receipt of the auto accident claim and outlining further procedures.
Customer was asked to provide additional documentation, including photos of the damaged vehicle and a police report to support the claim investigation.
The customer submitted all required documents promptly, helping to speed up the assessment of the collision damage and liability.
An investigation team began reviewing the submitted evidence and accident report to determine fault and claim validity.
The investigation concluded with a finding that the customer was not at fault and the damage was consistent with the reported collision.
A fair settlement was proposed to the customer covering the vehicle repair costs and any associated expenses from the accident.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the prompt handling and proposed settlement associated with their vehicle collision claim.
After customer agreement, the claim was officially approved for payment to cover damages from the auto accident incident.
The settlement amount was transferred to the customer's account to cover repair costs for the damaged vehicle following the accident.
The claim was formally closed after payment issuance and confirmation that all procedures related to the auto accident were completed.
The auto accident claim file was archived for record-keeping and future reference in the insurance system database.
